attributes.action: Include British colonialism & historic atrocities in the school curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
It has been shown that in 2020, so many British people are unaware of the extent of British impacts to other countries and regions due to the acts of colonial oppression that were done by invading British forces, and this ignorance allows a great deal of racial issues to be dismissed. 
Having a full and complete understanding of everything our country has done will allow the institutions of structural and systemic racism to be seen, understood and dismantled to be benefit of the whole country.
attributes.background: Change the school curriculum to ensure that it is a mandatory element of history and modern studies classes that the history of British slavery, colonialism and the impacts this has had on the world are taught and understood.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
